events.name: Come and learn and get to know each other
events.description: Agenda: 1) Quick Introduction and Welcome 2) Updates from GraphConnect and openCypher by Neo4i 3) Technical session - FRAUD detection with Neo4j by Stefan Kolmar, Neo4j 4) Technical session - Neo4J and Python API by Eric Lee Light refreshments will be provided.
events.location: A*STAR Computational Resource Centre, Charles Babbage Room, Level 17  1 Fusionopolis Way, Connexis (South Tower), Singapore

events.name: Anticipatory Design: Invisible Interfaces and Predictive Products
events.description: The value of experience design is changing. Tools that were once designed to help people make decisions are being reimagined into products and services that actively make people's lives easier through anticipating what a user wants and making choices on their behalf. New smart products and services that anticipate user needs and make decisions according to our preferences with as little interaction as possible will release us from the tyranny of choice and give us more time to spend on the things that matter most.  Join UX Director Kieran Weston to learn about how the next wave of design thinking is creating a future of digital products and services that will noticeably improve our day to day lives and afford people more time for human experiences in a digital world. There will be snacks and drinks! Location: Huge's office is located at 33 Ann Siang Rd., Suite 31A. When you arrive, please check in with staff at the building entrance.  About the Speaker As UX Director at Huge Singapore, Kieran leads a multi-talented team of interaction designers and product designers to create digital products and services that people love. Kieran specialises in mobile interface design and has worked with international companies across finance (MetLife, Citibank, Standard Chartered), media and publishing (SBS, Astro, Elsevier, The Economist, Singapore Press Holdings), retail (Westfield, Woolworths), entertainment (Sydney Opera House) and government (Australian state government). Kieran has worked on large scale global projects with clients from China, Singapore, Australia and the UK. He prides himself on delivering solutions that create innovative and seamless interactions between business, technology and most importantly customers.
events.location: Huge Singapore, 33 Ann Siang Rd, Suite 31A

events.name: Java Cloud Application Developer Workshop on Bluemix
events.description: Technology is the #1 critical imperative for businesses – those who harness Cloud and move toward a composable business gain significant benefits.  I’d like to personally thank you for accepting the invitation to Java Cloud Developer Application Workshop. Here you will have the opportunity to deploy application and have it running in a matter of hours in Bluemix. As part of this workshop you will be able to learn: · Eclipse tooling and continuous integration using DevOps,· Introduction to Microservices,· Application renovation and migration approaches· Database services in Bluemix· Watson and Alchemy services Date: 17th December 2015 Time: 6:30 PM – 8:00 PM Venue: Plugin @ Block 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent #02-01 Singapore[masked] Prior to Workshop:  Please sign up for free trial Bluemix, DevOps accounts.· Bluemix: https://ibm.biz/bluemixjavaevent· Bluemix DevOps: http://hub.jazz.net Refreshments provided!See you there!
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951

events.name: Open Space @ Sandcraw­ler (Agile Contracting)
events.description: We're bringing OST (Open Space Technology) closer to the west so that it is easier for people living near to attend! Open Space Facilitator: Steven Koh from IDA Open Space Theme: Agile Contracting AOB: Drivers may park their cars at Galaxis or Fusionopolis. Sandcrawler does not provide parking for visitors. Agenda 7:00pm - Networking and food 7:30pm - Topic generation 8:00pm - Breakout sessions 10:00pm - End We welcome contributions of drinks and snacks! =) What is Open Space? Open Space is a highly collaborative and self-organised meeting where topics are generated on the spot and discussed by the participants through breakout sessions. For more information read Open Space Technology. Venue and food sponsor

events.name: Sketchstorming
events.description: A workshop for Sketchstorming.  Agenda: • 15min: Networking • 10min: Viki team shares how sketchstorming fits into the product development process and why. • 5min: Challenge review. • 1hr: Form a group of 4-5 people, then start the sketchstorming exercise. • 20min: Discussion. • 5min: Wrapping up.
events.location: Rakuten Crimson House, 138 Market Street, Lvl 32, CapitaGreen, 048946, Singapore

events.name: Show and Tell 2015
events.description: Meet at George Gally's office and share with all the rest of us what you've done this year! Cedric Honet will also be joining us before he leaves Singapore again.

events.name: iOS Dev Scout December Meetup
events.description: Speakers: • Subh • Mugunth Kumar  Tentative Agenda:  • 6:45pm: Dinner  • 7:15pm: Subh - will talk about Model-View-ViewModel and how it helps to write better tests for your apps• 7:45pm: Mugunth - will speak about tvOS SDK and APIs • 8:15pm: Show & Tell (If any) • 8:30pm: iOS Quiz (winners will get some prize!)  Related Links • Introduction to MVVM • tvOS Programming Guide
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore
